page.title: 02Farming 2
page.content: Mr. James Hadley keeps a pig farm.He has some arable land too. Mr. Hadley's farm is 25 acres. He does not need as much land as an arable or beef farmer, because his piggery is in large sheds. It is intensive farming. Mr. Hadley has seen many changes in his farming life. Intensive animal units, bigger fields (to accommodate large farm machinery), hedgerows have disappeared and government controls have been introduced. Mr. Hadley sells his pigs by a contract system. If he sold them at the market he would be unsure of the price they would fetch. This way he is sure of some profit. His pigs are sold to a pork distributer.
